intro: Talinum polyphyllum, commonly known as red leaf spinach, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking red, velvety leaves and edible, tender stems. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are rich in nutrients and are often used in traditional dishes. Talinum polyphyllum thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
